titleStmt.title: A discoverie, what God, the supreame judge, through his servant hath caused to bee manifested unto the regents or rulers in England, concerning their Cain-like, fierce, nay diabolicall contentions and furious distractions, by which they bring themselves with all their land and subjects in utter distruction. Besides, that they have left their distressed fellovv-members and brethren in Germany stincking in their perdition and misery, vvhich all God will judge. Rom. I:2. 2. Pet. 3.

publicationStmt.date: Printed in the jeare of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ, 1643.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
